content: FOUR! THAT'S IT! Pakistan pull off a big chase with ease and stay alive in the series! On a back of a length, outside off, Hasan waits on the back foot and just glides it with an open bat face to the left of short third for a boundary to take his side over the line. Handshakes and smiles all around in the Pakistan camp as they canter home!

HUNDRED FOR HASAN! Maiden T20I ton for the 22-year-old and it could not have come at a better time for him and Pakistan. Sliding onto the pads, on a short of a length, Nawaz gets inside the line and swats it to the left of deep fine leg for a boundary. Nawaz gets a hug from his skipper and everyone in the Pakistani dugout is up on their feet. Just 2 more needed for Pakistan.
Wide! Jamieson bangs in a slower bumper, around off, Hasan shapes up to play the upper cut but decides against it in the end. It sails over his head for a wide.
On a hard length, on middle and leg, Salman gets on his toes and drops it down in front of mid-wicket for a single.
Miscued but safe! Pace taken off, on a short of a length, on off, Nawaz swings a bit too hard and loses his shape. The ball gets sliced across but it clears extra cover. They cross.
Low full toss, on off, Hasan goes deep in the crease and drills it to the right of deep cover for a couple of runs.

FIFTY FOR AGHA! An entertaining knock from the Pakistani skipper and ever since he arrived, he has kept the momentum going! On a back of a length, on middle, Agha nudges it through square leg for a single.

SIX! Clever, very clever! Dug in short by Ben, around off, Hasan arches back and waits for the ball to arrive. Uses the pace of the ball as he ramps it over the keeper for six more. Hasan moves to 94.
SIX! Flayed away! Banged into the deck but width offered on off, Hasan throws his hands at it. The ball flies over deep backward point for a flat six.
Big swing and a miss! On a nagging length, around off, Hasan swings for the hills as he backs away but connects with thin air.
On a good length, on off, Agha looks to play at it but gets a bit rushed. Ekes out an inside edge that rolls away on the leg side for one.
FOUR LEG BYES! Too straight, too full, on the pads, Agha swings to help it away but misses. The ball goes off the pads and beats short fine leg for a boundary.
Good stop! Sears gets the yorker in, on off, Nawaz squeezes it out towards backward point where Tim Seifert dives to his right and makes the stop.
Dragged length, around off and middle, Nawaz pushes it to long on for a single to end the over. Pakistan need just 30 runs now off the last six overs.
SWING AND MISS! Tossed it up and well outside off, Hasan Nawaz goes on his knee and looks to swing it down the ground but misses.
Short and around off and middle, Salman Agha pushes it to long on for a single. He wants to have another but is sent back by his partner. The 100-run partnership comes up between the two as well!

FOUR! A hat-trick of boundaries for the Pakistani skipper! Sodhi keeps the line and length similar, short and outside off, Salman Agha slices it again and beats the diving backward point fielder to his right for a boundary.
FOUR! Back-to-back boundaries for Salman! Sodhi drops it short and well outside off, Salman Agha goes back and cuts it to the right of backward point for another boundary.

FOUR! PURE TIMING! Sodhi drags his length after seeing the batter coming down the track, Salman Agha adjusts it in the end and just chips it aerially down the ground over the bowler's head. The ball goes into the ropes between long on and long off.
On a good length, touch outside off, Salman Agha cuts it to deep backward point for a single.

SIX! STREAKY BUT SALMAN WON'T MIND IT! Short of a length, into the body of the batter, around middle, Salman Agha swivels and looks to pull it. He gets a top edge only which goes over deep fine leg for a biggie.
A yorker around off, with pace this time, Salman Agha jams it out back to the bowler to his right who picks it up on his follow-through and makes a throw at the batter's end but misses.
Hard length and around off, Salman Agha nudges it with soft hands towards long on and picks up two runs.

FOUR! STREAKY! Slightly fuller than the previous one and into the line of the stumps, Salman Agha makes room a bit and looks to slog it across to the leg side. He gets a thick inside edge that goes through between his legs and for a boundary at deep fine leg.
SIX! TOP SHOT! An off-cutter by Jacob Duffy, on a good length and outside off, Salman Agha swings and thumps it over cover for a biggie.

Hard length and outside off, with pace off, Hasan Nawaz comes down the track and swings at it and gets it through the toe end of the bat. The ball goes over extra cover and the batters take a couple of runs.
FOUR! INNOVATIVE! A bouncer by Jamieson and around middle, Hasan Nawaz waits for it and opens the face of the bat to use the pace of the ball. He guides it over the keeper for a boundary.
Leg bye! Slower again, on the pads, on a good length, Salman Agha looks to tickle it but misses and gets hit on the pad. He runs off for a leg bye as the ball rolls away towards square leg.
BEATEN! Bangs in short of a length, touch outside off, Salman Agha looks to cut it off late but gets beaten on the outside edge.
Back of a length, with pace off, moves away after pitching, Salman Agha looks to turn it to the leg side but checks his shot in the end and drops it down towards mid-wicket.
FOUR! PICKED IT UP! A bit slower, on a length and on the pads, easy for Salman Agha as he moves across and flicks it wide of deep fine leg for a boundary.
Short and around off, Salman punches it to long on off the back foot for a single.
Similar length, but on the pads, Salman Agha comes down the track and looks to swipe it across to the leg side. He misses and gets hit on the front pad.
Dragged length, around off and middle, Nawaz nudges it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
FOUR! SWEPT AWAY! Nagging length, around off, Hasan Nawaz goes a bit low and fetches out to sweep it towards deep backward square leg for a boundary.

In the air... but it lands safely! Tossed it up, around off, Salman Agha goes on his knee and sweeps it. He gets a top edge as the ball goes high in the air towards deep square leg but falls down ahead of the incoming fielder and the batters run for a single.
Drags his length after seeing batter coming down the track, around off, Salman Agha chips it back to the bowler.
Short of a length, around off, Salman guides it to deep third man for a single.
Back of a length, touch outside off, Salman cuts it but straight to backward point.

DROPPED! A good bouncer by Ben Sears and around the right shoulder of the batter, Hasan Nawaz swivels and looks to hook it. He gets a top edge as the ball comes faster than he expected. The ball goes towards deep fine leg where Ish Sodhi spills an easy chance. The batters run for a single.
FOUR! TOP SHOT! Hard length, around middle, Hasan Nawaz clears out his front leg and thumps it down the ground over mid on for a boundary.

SIX! LUCKY FOR HASAN! Sears bangs it a short of a length, into the body of the batter, Hasan Nawaz lifts his front leg up and looks to pull it from the back foot. He mistimes it as he gets hurried by the pace and gets a top edge that sails over the keeper behind the wicket for a biggie.
FOUR! HELPED ON ITS WAY! Good length on the pads, easy for Hasan Nawaz as he hops up a bit and flicks it to deep backward square leg for a boundary.
Full and outside off, Salman slices it but straight to backward point.
Short of a length, around off, Hasan Nawaz puls it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.

SIX! CLEAN STRIKE! Hasan Nawaz completes his maiden fifty in just 26 balls! Neesham bowls it in the slot, full around middle, Hasan Nawaz clears his front leg and thumps it down the ground for a biggie to complete his milestone. He has set up this chase in favour of Pakistan here.
WIDE! Back of a length and well outside off, with pace off, Hasan Nawaz misses the cut. Called a wide.
BEATEN AGAIN! Fuller and wide outside off, keeps it away from the batter's arc, Hasan Nawaz makes too much room and tries to extend his arms to reach out but misses.
BEATEN! Goes fuller and well outside off, Hasan Nawaz goes a bit low to drive it but gets beaten on the outside edge.
On a good length and outside off, Salman slices it towards deep point for a single. 100 comes up for Pakistan.
Ends with a good bouncer, into the body of the batter, Salman Agha ducks under it.
Back of a length, around off, Salman guides it to deep third for a single.

EDGED AND FOUR! Sears bowls it on a hard length again and touch outside off, Salman Agha throws his hands at it and looks to punch it to the off side. He gets a thick outside edge that goes to the right of the keeper for a boundary behind the wicket.
Hard length, on the pads, Nawaz clips it to deep square leg for a single.

FOUR! STREAKY! Sears hits the deck hard and on a good length, on the fourth stump, Hasan Nawaz clears out his front leg and looks to slog it across to the leg side. He generates a top edge that flies to the right of the deep third man fielder for a boundary.
BEATEN! Back of a length and touch outside off, gets it to move away a bit, Hasan Nawaz looks to guide it to third man but gets beaten by the pace.
A bit quicker and flatter, into the stumps, Hasan taps it down towards extra cover and runs off for a quick single.

FOUR! DEFT TOUCH! Too short and wide outside off, Hasan Nawaz moves across to reach out and opens the face of the bat to use the pace of the ball. He guides it in the gap between backward point and short third man for a boundary.
Dragged length, around off, Salman pushes it towards deep backward point for a single.
Slows it up, on a nagging length and outside off, Hasan Nawaz cuts it to deep backward point for a single.
SIX! CRACKING SHOT! Floated it up, right in the slot, just outside off, Hasan Nawaz goes on his knee and slogs it over long on for a biggie.
Tossed it up from over the wicket, Salman Agha comes forward to drive it to long off for a single.
On the back of a length, slightly around off. Salman Agha works it down to deep third for a single. New Zealand end their Powerplay on a strong note - 75/1.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND TAKEN! CAUGHT BEHIND! Duffy runs in hard and bends his back, bowls it short and on top of the stumps. Mohammad Haris swivels to pull, but is cramped up a bit for room. He does go through the shot, but ends up top edging it over the keeper's head. Mitchell Hay settles under it as the ball swirls and descends. Hay locks his eyes on the ball, and takes a fine catch. Finally, New Zealand get their first wicket as Mohammad Haris departs on 41 (20). Pakistan are 74/1, needing 131 runs to win in 14.1 overs.
Mohammad Haris (wk) c M Hay b J Duffy 41 (20b 4x4 3x6)
Angling on the pads, on a good length, clipped fine to short fine leg.
FOUR! Threads the gap neatly! Back of a length, around off, Mohammad Haris rises with the bounce and places it beautifully between backward point and short third for a boundary.
Skids through off the deck, on a good length, at the pads, Mohammad Haris misses to tuck it across and is pinged on the thigh pad.
Landed fuller and on off, Hasan Nawaz swings and slices over the covers. Michael Bracewell from the inner ring gives it a chase. Slides to flick the ball inside the arena. Saves one run. Three taken.
Length, on the stumps, pulled across to the left of the mid-wicket region for a single.

SIX! The ball is just sailing over the fence! That was not a bad delivery at all! Bracewell drags the length, on off, Hasan Nawaz transfers the weight quickly on the back foot, and flat bats it over long off for a six.
Slower through the air, pushed around off, Mohammad Haris gets down on his knee and mistimes the sweep shot to the right of square leg for a single.
Good length, outside off, turning in, Hasan Nawaz hangs back and punches it to long on for one more.
Sliding into the pads, on a length, Mohammad Haris tickles it to short fine leg for one.

SIX! Michael Bracewell is greeted into the attack with a biggie! Landed right into the slot, on the off stump line, Mohammad Haris finds the ball in his arc, sits down on his knee and slogs it behind deep mid-wicket for a six.
SIX! What a shot! Shorter in length again from Kyle Jamieson, on the stumps, Hasan Nawaz backs away and this time, he connects just well enough to pull it behind deep mid-wicket for a cracking six.
Into the bodyline on a shorter length, Hasan Nawaz swings to pull, but misses.

Good work there by Daryl Mitchell! Back of a length, on the stumps, Hasan Nawaz weighs on the back foot and pulls over mid-wicket. The ball keeps dribbling to the fence, but it is a huge pocket in the deep and Daryl Mitchell swoops in with a slide and saves a couple of runs for his side.

FOUR! On the bounce, into the fence! Full and angling on off, Hasan Nawaz backs away and tonks it over the bowler. However, the connection is off the toe-end but the ball does clear mid off, and goes on the bounce for a boundary.
On the shorter side, angling on top of off, Hasan Nawaz leans on the back foot, and looks to loft it over the bowler but misses as he plays inside the line.
WIDE! Identical line and length, left alone. Wide given again.
WIDE! Way down leg on a length. Wide called.

Slower one, on the pads, good length, Mohammad Haris gets a bit across to work into the leg side, but inside edges it to the left of the keeper. Mitchell Hay dives to his left and stops the ball, but they cross for a single.
Swing and a miss! Touch full and around off, skidding through off the seam. Hasan Nawaz swings for the hills but connects thin air.
FOUR! Butchered! Back of a length, on top of off, Hasan Nawaz stays leg side of the ball, gets a bit forward and frees his arms. Times the ball to perfection and gets it past covers for a boundary.

Banged short on top of off, Mohammad Haris hops on the bounce and guides it to deep third. Ish Sodhi runs and dives across to his left to cut it off. A single taken. Good fielding effort there by Sodhi.
Length, on off, punched into the off side.

FOUR! Races away! On off, shaping away, full in length. Mohammad Haris gets in a bit of a tangle as he opens up his body and the ball takes a bit of an outside edge to run through the deep third region for a boundary. No chance for the fielder to cut it off to his left.
Back of a length, lifting off the deck, outside off, guided away to deep third for a single.
WIDE! A false start for Sears! Down leg, on a fullish length. Hasan Nawaz misses to flick. Wide called.
FOUR! Whipped away! Angling into the leg stump line, too full and straight. Mohammad Haris picks it up, uses his wrists and flicks it over short fine leg for a boundary.

Leading edge, falls safe! Full in length, on middle and leg. Haris closes his bat face a bit too early to play it across in the leg side. A leading edge is found and the ball lobs in front of the mid on region, lands safe.
Swing and a miss! Hard length, skidding off the deck, outside off, Mohammad Haris swings and misses as the ball passes above his angled bat.
FOUR! Uppish, but in the gap! Fuller in length, shaping away a shy bit, Mohammad Haris leans on it and slices it in the air, to the left of the point fielder for a boundary.
Full and on middle and leg, this is pushed to the left of mid on by Nawaz. A quick single taken.
A slip in place for Duffy! Good length, outside off, Mohammad Haris plays it late, opens the bat face, and the ball goes uppishly through the short third region for a single.
On the shorter side, outside off, Mohammad Haris rides the bounce and taps it towards deep third for a single to end the over. A positive start for Pakistan. 15/0.

SIX! Innovative, and effective! Pitched fuller in length again from Kyle, on the middle and leg stump line, Mohammad Haris shuffles across the stumps and just scoops it over the keeper's head for a six.
SIX! He has picked the bones out of it! Into the arc, fuller and around off, Mohammad Haris gets on the front foot and lofts it over long off for a handsome six.
Angling on the pads, good length, Hasan Nawaz tucks it away to the widish short fine leg region. A little fumble there by the fielder allows the batters to cross for a single.
Hits the deck hard, on middle, Hasan Nawaz gets right behind it and blocks it off the back foot.

On the money! A well-attempted yorker from Jamieson, but Pakistan get underway! An inswinging yorker on middle, Mohammad Haris jams his bat down, just in time, and inside edges to the short fine leg region. A single taken.

OUT! GONE! CAUGHT! New Zealand have been bowled out! Pitched on a hard length, on the leg stump line, just trying to cramp the batter for room. Jacob Duffy however, clears the front leg to create some space, but loses his shape as he goes through the shot, to clear long on. Mistimes it and it goes only as far as the long on fielder. Irfan Khan gets underneath and completes the catch.
Jacob Duffy c I Khan b A Afridi 2 (4b 0x4 0x6)
On a good length, at the pads, Ben Sears looks to whip across to the leg side, but the ball ricochets off the thigh pad. Lobs and lands near the strip on the leg side. They cross for a leg bye.

Put down? That was bludgeoned like a bullet! Landed fuller and on off, Duffy clears his front foot and smashes it flat and back to the bowler, Abbas tries to get away from the ball, but the reaction time is too short and is hit on the hands. The ball deflects off and runs to the long off region. A single taken.
Slower and fuller on the pads, Sears tucks it away to fine leg for a single.
Full in length, angling on the leg stump. Jacob Duffy tries to work it to the leg side but gets some pad as the ball rolls in the leg side. They cross for a leg bye.

FOUR! Streaky, but they all count! The 200 is up for New Zealand! Back of a length and wide off off. Sears goes for a cut shot but ends up chopping at it. It bounces around the off stump and runs away to the vacant deep third fence.
Full and angling into the pads, Ben Sears flicks it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a couple of quick runs.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Rauf is on a roll here as he gets his third wicket! Back of a length from Rauf, on top of the off stump, this one skids through very quickly off the surface, with a bit of lift as well. Ish Sodhi stays leg side, and tries to smash it into the stands with a pull shot, but only manages to get an outside edge. Mohammad Haris, behind the wickets, does the rest as he takes a regulation catch.
Ish Sodhi c M Haris b H Rauf 10 (10b 1x4 0x6)

Some casual running there by Duffy. Good length on the off stump line, skidding through. Jacob works it to the left of mid off and is through for a single. But he doesn't show any haste and is almost jogging to get to the other end. The fielder realises and scores a direct hit at the bowling end. Duffy is saved as he drags the bat in time at the non-striker's end. And the side-on replay confirms the same.

OUT! BOWLED! CLEANED HIM UP! Haris Rauf runs in hard and takes all the pace off from the ball. This is the slower one, pitched on the fractionally fuller length, at the stumps. Michael Bracewell is months early into his shot and goes through early as he tries to heave across into the leg side. Only manages to inside edge it, onto the pads, and then into the stumps. Haris Rauf gets his second wicket and New Zealand are 193/8.
Michael Bracewell (c) b H Rauf 31 (18b 3x4 2x6)
On the stumps, on the pads, Ish Sodhi hops across and tucks it to deep backward square leg for a single.

FOUR! An expensive over from Shaheen. On the fuller side, angling into the pads, Michael Bracewell picks it up well and heaves it across to deep mid-wicket for a cracking boundary. New Zealand are up and running again. 17 runs from Shaheen's last over.
WIDE! Wayward down leg, on a length. Left alone.

MISFIELD, FOUR! No, that won't help Pakistan at all. Shaheen, by the looks of him, is fuming. Good length, around off, Michael Bracewell prods half forward and smashes it down to long off. Abbas Afridi makes an absolute mess as the ball evades between his legs and runs into the fence. A schoolboy error there.
WIDE! Speared down the leg stump line. Michael Bracewell lets it be. A good diving stop by Mohammad Haris to his right, behind the stumps.
Another fuller one, on off, played into the off side for a single.
FOUR! Much needed for New Zealand! A genuine half volley from Shaheen, across off, Ish Sodhi gets his bat under it and lofts it over the leaping mid off fielder, to his left for a boundary.
Very full, around off, Michael Bracewell shovels it down to the right of long on for a single.
Around the stumps, an attempted yorker on off, Ish Sodhi bends low and carves it out to deep third for a single.

At 135 kph, on middle and on a good length, skidding off the deck, Ish Sodhi hops across and taps it to the mid-wicket region for a quick single. An excellent over by Haris Rauf. Just three runs from it. His figures read 3-0-21-1 so far.
Length-delivery, around off, Michael Bracewell stays on the back foot and punches it through cover and point for a single.
Aims the stumps, does Rauf, on a good length, Michael Bracewell gets behind it and blocks it back to the bowler.
Shorter in length, outside off, Ish Sodhi plays it late, opens the bat face and glides it down to deep third for a single.
Back of a length, skidding through off the deck, on off, Ish Sodhi hops on the back foot and stabs it on the surface.
Good length and on off. Sodhi plays it on the rise to block.
Full again, this is driven straight to mid off.
Full on the off stumps. Ish Sodhi clips it to wide long on. A single to get off the mark.
On a length and outside the off stump. Michael Bracewell knocks off the back foot to deep cover for a single.
EDGED AND FOUR! Too full, on off, Michael Bracewell tries to shovel it out into the off side, outside edges it to the vacant deep third for a boundary.

FOUR? Or not? No, two runs saved in the field! A short ball, on the leg stump line, Michael Bracewell pulls it between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket. Shaheen Afridi runs across and throws himself to the right to stop the ball, gets his hands to it and flicks it in the arena, but gets in a bit of a tangle as Irfan Khan from deep mid-wicket converges in and almost collides Shaheen, as the latter tries to keep the ball inside the field of play. Irfan hops over Shaheen, picks the ball up and throws it back to the keeper.
Full on the leg stump, worked back to the bowler.

OUT! BOWLED! Action-replay and Abrar Ahmed picks up another wicket, and will be on a HAT TRICK at the start of his next over! Dishes out another wrong'un, does Abrar, and lands it on the off stump line. It pitches and takes the bite, turns back into the batter sharply. Kyle Jamieson looks to work it to the off side, but inside edges it into the stumps. New Zealand are in a spot of a bother here, as they slip down to 164/7.
Kyle Jamieson b A Ahmed 0 (1b 0x4 0x6)

OUT! OUTFOXED! Pakistan keep chipping in with wickets at crucial phases. This is a nicely tossed-up delivery by Abrar, a deceptive wrong'un, landed on the middle and leg stump line, on a fuller length. Mitchell Hay shapes up to tonk it into the stands but ends up playing the wrong line, as he fails to read the googly off the bowler's hand. The ball sneaks through the gap between the bat and pad and crashes into the wickets.
Mitchell Hay (wk) b A Ahmed 9 (8b 0x4 1x6)
Good length, turning into the batter, Michael Bracewell works it to deep mid-wicket for a single.

SIX! BANG! Another one, on the shorter side, on the leg stump line, Michael Bracewell hangs back and pauses for a bit to let the ball arrive. Swings across and pulls it over deep mid-wicket for a six.
Back of a length, at the stumps, worked past mid on for a single.
SIX! That's hit into the orbit! A half-tracker from Abrar, on off, Mitchell Hay goes deep inside the crease and launches it over long on for a massive six.
SIX! SMASHED! Too full, right in the slot, and well outside off, Michael Bracewell comes forward and thumps it over long off for a biggie.
Full and on the pads, Mitchell Hay helps on its way to short fine leg for a single.
Short just outside off, Mitchell Hay pats it down to point for no run.

Leg bye! An appeal for LBW but is turned down by the umpire! Dragged length, around middle, turns away a bit as well, Michael Bracewell goes on his knee to sweep but misses and gets hit on the front pad. He runs off for a leg bye as the ball gets deflected towards point.
Touch fuller and around off, Michael Bracewell pushes it back to the bowler to his left.
Nagging length, on the pads, Michael Bracewell defends it to mid-wicket.
On a good length, around off, Michael Bracewell pushes it towards mid on for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! A heartbreak for Mark Chapman as he misses out on a hundred here! He goes for 94 runs off just 44 balls. Shaheen Afridi picks up his second wicket as he bowls it slower again, on a good length and around middle. Mark Chapman looks to turn it away on the leg side with a closed bat face but the ball gets a bit big on him. The ball goes off a leading edge towards backward point where Shadab Khan moves to his left a bit and takes it with both hands.
Mark Chapman c S Khan b S Afridi 94 (44b 11x4 4x6)
FOUR! WHACKED! Afridi keeps it slower and short of a length, well outside off, and offers width, Mark Chapman gives himself room by going to the leg side. He pumps it over extra cover for a boundary.
Takes the pace off, back of a length, around middle, Mitchell Hay nudges it with soft hands towards deep mid-wicket and runs off for a single.

Touch fuller and around off and middle, Mark Chapman shows the full face of the bat and chips it aerially down the ground for a single. The fielder in the deep does well to move to his right to collect the ball.
Hard length, around off, Hay chops it out towards short third man.
No run.

OUT! LBW! GONE! Abbas Afridi breaks a partnership here! He comes in from around the wicket and bowls it on a good length, gets it to come back in with the angle. James Neesham is caught up in the crease as he looks to play it to the leg side with a closed bat face. He gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball hits him on the back pad. Abbas goes for an appeal for LBW and the umpire also raises his finger. James Neesham asks his partner but decides against the review. James Neesham departs without much impact - 3 (7) and New Zealand are 135/4.
James Neesham lbw A Afridi 3 (7b 0x4 0x6)
On a good length, around off, Chapman chips it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Back of a length, around middle and leg, Mark Chapman nudges it wide of deep square leg for a couple of runs.

SIX! STREAKY! Abbas bangs in short of a length, around middle and leg, Mark Chapman swivels and looks to hook it. He gets hurried by the pace as the ball takes the top edge of the bat and flies over the keeper behind the wicket. The third umpire checks it and calls a six.
FOUR! PUNISHED! Hard length and well outside off, Mark Chapman comes down the track and throws his hands at it. He slaps it over extra cover for a boundary.
Nagging length, around off, Mark pushes it to long on for a single to end the over.
WIDE! Bowls it quick again but wide outside off, Mark Chapman doesn't offer any shot at it. Called a wide.
FOUR! Powered away! Keeps it shorter and into the body this time, Mark Chapman goes back and pulls it towards long on. The fielder runs to his left and dives but in vain.
SIX! THUMPED! Drops it short and just outside off, Mark Chapman uses his feet and whacks it down the ground over long on for a biggie.
Quick again, full on middle, James pushes it to long on for a single.

FOUR BYES! Quicker and flatter, sliding on around leg, goes on with the angle, James Neesham makes room and looks to slog it across to the leg side. The ball goes past the leg stump and the keeper also misses it as the ball runs away to the boundary behind the wickets.
Tossed it up, around off, James Neesham slices it through the outer half of the bat towards backward point. He wants to have a single but is sent back by his partner.
FOUR! Good shot! Quicker and flatter, on the pads, Mark Chapman comes down the track and flicks it aerially over mid-wicket for a boundary.
Dragged length again, on the pads, Neesham flicks it to deep square leg for a single.
Nagging length, around middle and leg, Chapman pushes it to long on for another single.
Floated it up, around off and middle, James Neesham chips it aerially towards long on and takes a single.
Tossed it up, around off, James Neesham nudges it to mid-wicket.

OUT! CAUGHT! Pakistan make a breakthrough here and Shadab Khan picks up a crucial wicket here! He bowls a leg break, well outside off, and offers flight, Daryl Mitchell goes a bit low and looks to drive it inside out over cover. He has to reach out to play at it and only manages to get a thick outside edge. The ball goes in the air towards short third man where Haris Rauf picks up another catch of the night. New Zealand are 98/3.
Daryl Mitchell c H Rauf b S Khan 17 (11b 1x4 1x6)

SIX! CLUBBED! A big over for New Zealand again! Nagging length, but on the pads, Mark Chapman transfers his weight to the back foot and pulls it towards deep mid-wicket. The ball sails just over the fielder in the deep.
Drags his length, around middle, Mitchell knocks it down to long on for a single.
SIX! TOP SHOT! In the slot, gives flight, too full, Daryl Mitchell gives himself some room by clearing out his front leg. He thumps it down the ground over the bowler's head for a biggie.
Tossed it up, around off and middle, Mark pushes it to long off for a single this time.
Quick and flat, around middle, Mark drives it to the right of long off for another couple of runs.

Mark Chapman completes his 9th T20I fifty! Nagging length, around leg, Mark Chapman presses back and pulls it to the left of long on for a couple of runs to complete his milestone. Quite an authoritative inning so far. This is Chapman's 4th T20I fifty against Pakistan, along with a century.
Floated it up, around middle, Chapman pushes it to long on for a single. Moves to 49.

FOUR! A sloppy effort in the deep and a boundary for New Zealand! Short and on middle, Mark Chapman goes back and pulls it to deep backward square leg. Irfan Khan runs to his left and the ball spins after the bounce and the fielder overruns it as the ball goes over the ropes.
FOUR! HELPS ON ITS WAY! Fires in on the pads again, not a great line to a set batter, Mark Chapman goes a bit low and flicks it towards deep fine leg for a boundary.
Dragged length, around middle, Daryl Mitchell pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Hard length, on the pads, Mark uses her wrists to turn it to deep square leg for a single to end the over.
Bangs in short of a length, around middle and leg, Daryl Mitchell goes back and clips it to deep square leg for a single.
Back of a length, around off, Mark Chapman swings at it and chips it aerially to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Hits the deck hard, on short of a length, into the body, Mark Chapman swivels and pulls it along the ground wide of deep fine leg for a couple of runs.
FOUR! PUT AWAY! Hard length, in the channel, outside off, Mark Chapman stands tall this time and punches it in the gap between cover and mid off for a boundary.

Good effort by the skipper Salman Agha! Back of a length from over the wicket, around off, Mark Chapman uses his feet and flat-bats it towards long off. Salman puts in a dive to his right and saves two runs for his side.

Another risky single taken! Mark Chapman had given up and had the throw hit, it would have been curtains for him. Full and straight, at the stumps, Mark pats it straight to mid on and sets off for a single. Rauf collects and has a shy at the bowling end but misses.

Around off, on the fuller side, Daryl Mitchell extends his hands into the shot and eases the drive past cover. The ball does not have enough legs to reach the ropes and it is cut off. Three runs taken.

A stifled appeal for caught behind but turned down! A nip-backer from Abbas, on a good length, on off, Daryl Mitchell gets his hands out in front and presents a straight bat to defend. The ball jags back in to go past the inside edge and it brushes the back pad on its way to the keeper. Good diving grab to his left by Mohammad Haris but the replays show that there was no bat involved.

FOUR! Agricultural but effective! This is on a back of a length, this sits up to be hit, Daryl Mitchell swings a bit too hard to go across the line. The bat turns in his hand and it comes off the inner half to the left of deep square leg for a boundary.
A bit more effort on this one by Abbas, on a hard length, on middle, Mark drops it beside the pitch on the leg side and crosses over. 50 up for New Zealand!
Starts from around the wicket and offers a bit of width, on a back of a length, Chapman thumps it on the bounce to extra cover.
This skids through and hurries the batter up, on a hard length, on off, Mark gets on his toes to keep it out. The ball goes off the inside edge of the bat and sneaks past the stumps for a single.

FOUR! Sloppy from Shadab Khan! Pace taken off by Rauf, on off, on a length, Mark pushes it towards mid off where Shadab Khan gets his lands low to make the stop but the ball goes through his hands and legs and away for a boundary.
Angling away, on a length, Chapman firms the drive to mid off.

Risky single! At the stumps, on a good length, Daryl Mitchell drops it beside the pitch on the leg side. Rauf runs to his right and gets to the ball quickly but fails to gather it cleanly, allowing the batters to complete the run.
Beaten! In the channel on off, on a good length, this nibbles away, Daryl Mitchell tries to defend it with a straight bat and gets beaten.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! Haris Rauf makes an instant impact! Both Kiwi openers, who have been a thorn in the flesh for Pakistan this series, are gone inside the Powerplay. A cross-seam delivery from Rauf, pace taken off, on a good length, on middle and leg, Seifert backs away and tries to launch it down the ground but does not manage to read the change of pace. He is early into the shot and skies it straight up towards mid on where Salman Agha settles under it and does the rest. Tim Seifert departs on 19 (9), and New Zealand are 43/2.
Tim Seifert c S Agha b H Rauf 19 (9b 1x4 2x6)
Wide! Sprays it down leg first up does Rauf, Tim misses the tickle. Wide given.
SIX! Excellent shot! Floated up, on a nagging length, on off, Chapman walks across and gets close to the line of the ball. Gets on a knee and nails the slog sweep over square leg for a biggie.
FOUR! Short and punished! A half-tracker, on middle and leg, Chapman goes deep in the crease and pulls it behind square on the leg side for a boundary.

Sees the batter backing away and Abrar follows him. Tim tucks it wide of square leg and steals a quick single. Abrar is not pleased with the throw going to the batting end and he felt it should have gone to his end.
A bit slower and fuller, on middle, Chapman steps out and eases the drive to long on for a single.
This skids through, short in length, Chapman whips it straight to mid-wicket.
Bowls it on a nagging length, on middle, jabbed to mid-wicket.
On middle and leg, on a good length, Chapman knocks it wide of mid-wicket for a single.
This comes on slower than the batter expected, on a back of a length, around leg, Chapman looks to pull it away but misses as the ball stays a bit low and brushes his shirt.

Oh, that could have gone anywhere! At 122 kph, a cross-seam delivery that takes off after landing on the seam. Mark Chapman gets into a tangle as he rises to ride the bounce. The ball takes the shoulder of the bat and lands safely beside the pitch on the off side.
FOUR! Very streaky! A well-directed bumper from SA and he gets a good lift off the deck, Mark Chapman tries to take the short ball on but gets a top edge that flies over the keeper for a boundary.
Play and a miss! Outside off, on a good length, Mark Chapman looks to flay it away on the off side but gets beaten on the outside edge.
FOUR! Easy pickings! Too straight, sliding onto the hips with the angle, Mark hangs back and helps it past short fine leg for a boundary.
SIX! Clean strike! Looped up, on off, on the fuller side, Tim Seifert swings through the line and tonks it back over the bowler's head for yet another six.

Had the throw hit, Chapman was gone! Run out chance missed by Pakistan! Floated up, on middle, Seifert stabs it down beside the pitch on the leg side. Chapman sets off for a single and is more than halfway through the run. The square leg fielder gets to the ball quickly and fires in a throw on the bounce towards the bowling end. Luckily for Chapman, the throw does not hit and he gets in with a dive. Abrar Ahmed is animated while collecting the ball, as he is seen wanting Khushdil Shah to score a direct hit.

SIX! Cracking shot! Abrar slows it down and tries to keep it away from the batter's arc, on the shorter side, Tim makes an early movement towards the leg side and has to reach out eventually. Slaps it with disdain over extra cover for a flat six.
FOUR! Up and over! Sliding on with the arm, right in the arc, on middle and leg, Seifert clears his front leg and mows it over mid on for a boundary.
Flat and short, on off, Tim rocks back and cuts it straight to cover-point.
Pushes it across the left-hander from over the wicket, Chapman punches it down to long on with a straight bat for a single.
Angling back into the pads, on a length, Chapman nudges it wide of mid-wicket and gets off the mark with a single.

OUT! WHAT A GRAB! A 'Superman effort' from Haris Rauf and Finn Allen cannot believe his luck! First wicket of the series for Shaheen Afridi. Not the best of balls though as this tails back into the pads, too full, there to be helped away. Allen works it uppishly towards short fine leg where Rauf flings himself to his right and pulls off a spectacular catch with his right hand. The ball stays in his grasp even as his elbow hits the turf. Finn Allen departs for 0 (3) in his 50th T20I.
Finn Allen c H Rauf b S Afridi 0 (3b 0x4 0x6)
Takes pace off and drags the length back, on middle, Tim is a bit early into the heave and gets it to the left of deep fine leg for a single.
Leg bye! Afridi strays on the pads, on a length, Allen has a swing at it to get it behind square on the leg side but misses. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes off the pads towards short fine leg.
Goes searching for the yorker but ends up serving a low full toss, on off, Finn mistimes the drive off the inner half to mid on.
Tim Seifert and ​​​​New Zealand are underway! Shaping back into the pads from over the wicket, a bit too full, Tim glances it down to deep fine leg for a single.
